intro: Aeonium appendiculatum, commonly known as the "Coral Cactus," is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a white powdery coating called farina. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with yellow flowers in the spring. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil with bright sunlight. Aeonium appendiculatum is popular as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
